item.title: Chinese woman discovers true identity after colleagues’ comments prompt DNA test
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tropical Storm Rafael forms in Caribbean, to strengthen into hurricane before landfall in Cuba
item.description: Tropical Storm Rafael, anticipated to escalate into a hurricane, is projected to hit Florida later this week. The storm, currently south of Jamaica, will likely impact the Cayman Islands and Cuba with heavy rainfall, posing risks of floods and mudslides.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Could Saturn's largest moon Titan hold key to life? New research reveals insights
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US slams Israel with 'fail' grade for lack of progress on Gaza humanitarian aid
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The marble 'living Buddhas' trapped by Myanmar's civil war
Popular podcaster Joe Rogan endorses former US President Donald Trump ahead of elections
item.description: Joe Rogan, host of the popular podcast "The Joe Rogan Experience," publicly endorsed Donald Trump for president. This follows a lengthy interview where Trump discussed his presidency, the 2020 election, and even showed a scar from an alleged assassination attempt. Elon Musk joined the podcast to echo support for Trump and criticize the Democratic party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Russia launches Soyuz rocket with Iranian satellites into orbit
item.description: Russia launched a Soyuz rocket carrying two Ionosfera-M satellites for space weather monitoring and 53 smaller satellites, including two from Iran. This launch marks Iran's first private sector venture into space and highlights growing cooperation between Moscow and Tehran amidst Western accusations of Iranian drone supplies to Russia for the Ukraine conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Michael Moore confident of Kamala Harris win: 'MAGA people are going to be...'
item.description: ​Moore said the Trump campaign isn't really in touch with where the majority of Americans are at. “The majority of Americans do not want this divisiveness, they don’t want the threat of violence,” Moore said. Moore also presented analyst Rachel Bitecofer's prediction which discussed the popular predictions including Silver Nate's and Ann Selzer's and concluded that her gut says it's Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Trump said he could lose this election: 'Yeah, bad things happen'
item.description: "The internal "Donald J. Trump Administrative Update," from co-campaign manager Susie Wiles, outlines post-election plans. It uses the phrases "should we be victorious," "regardless of the outcome of the election" and "God willing" — acknowledging that the race may or may not turn out in Trump's favor," an Axios report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Viral Moo Deng predicts Trump will win US election 2024
item.description: The video of the moment when Moo Deng picked Donald Trump over Kamala Harris was filmed Monday -- a day before Election Day -- at the Khao Khewo Open Zoo in Chonburi, eastern Thailand. Moo Deng was called out of the water for the crucial test. The other hippo with Moo Deng picked Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sean Diddy turns 55 in jail; gets fruit, breakfast cake in meal: Report
item.description: Diddy's lawyers have asked a judge to restrict statements made by potential witnesses and their lawyers outside of court and cited the name of Courtney Burgess who has given many interviews in recent days. The team filed the documents Sunday asking the judge to expedite the process of responding to Diddy's motion for a gag order.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Monica Lewinsky trolled for voting Kamala Harris in US election 2024: 'Party that called her a who*e'
item.description: When the scandal broke, Lewinsky agreed to immunity from prosecution with the attorney general and provided definitive proof of her intimate relationship with the president -- a dress stained with Clinton's semen. "I did have a relationship with Miss Lewinsky that was not appropriate," Clinton had to admit later though he denied the relationship initially.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Early voting data a 'little scary' for Kamala Harris, says Ex-Obama campaign manager
item.description: Jim Messina, Obama's 2012 campaign manager, expressed concern over early voting trends showing a surge in Republican participation. While Democrats are witnessing promising turnout among women and young voters, Republicans appear to have improved their early voting strategy compared to the previous election, causing concern among Democrats but Messina said he thinks Harris is holding strong in the last leg of the campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Massive outrage over Imane Khelif's leaked medical report: 'Democrats hate women'
item.description: Khelif's gender became an election issue as Donald Trump included Imane's example in an advertisement critiquing the Biden-Harris administration's approach to gender ad athletics. GOP politicians like Vivek Ramaswamy, JD Vance also expressed their opinion that they won't allow men in the female category sports. The leaked report added to the outrage a day before the crucial election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nate Silver team's final prediction for US election: 'Polls are close, results might not be'
item.description: "...However, that doesn't mean the actual outcome will be all that close. If the polls are totally accurate we're in for a nail-biter on Tuesday night. But a systematic polling error is always possible, perhaps especially if you think pollsters are herding -- only publishing results that match the consensus. And because things are so close, even an average polling error would upend the state of the race," Silver Bulletin's latest poll said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nikki Haley says she doesn't agree with Trump 100% of the time but...
item.description: "No politician gets everything right. For those of us clear-eyed enough to see Mr Trump’s flaws and honest enough to acknowledge them, the question is whether we’re better off with his policies or his opponent’s," GOP leader Nikki Haley wrote in an op-ed for the Wall Street Journal as she announced her support for Trump and said despite her differences with him, Trump is clearly a better choice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin meets North Korean foreign minister in Moscow
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with North Korean foreign minister Choe Son Hui in the Kremlin on Monday, Moscow announced, amid western claims that Russia plans to deploy thousands of Pyongyang's troops to the Ukraine conflict. "President Putin received the foreign minister of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Choe Son Hui," the Kremlin said in a statement, publishing a video of the pair shaking hands ahead of talks.

item.title: John Oliver chokes up as he urges voters to elect Kamala Harris: 'I am an immigrant'
item.description: ​“Look, I love this country. I’m an immigrant. I chose to be here. In the words of the late, great Lee Greenwood: I’m proud to be an American. And I’d argue there is nothing more American than having a healthy, adversarial relationship with those in power, even if you voted for them," John Oliver said urging his audience to vote for Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: GOP strategist says all pollsters are getting US election wrong as they overlooked this shift
item.description: GOP strategist Alex Castellanos argued that polls underestimate Republican enthusiasm, citing a surge in Republican voter registration. ​“I think the pollsters are getting this wrong. We’re all missing something, because they’re giving us the same poll over and over again. There isn’t even statistical variation,” Castellanos said. ​The final NYT/Sienna poll said it will be a photo finish in the seven swing states -- Harris showing new strength in North Carolina and Georgia and Trump erasing her lead in Pennsylvania and maintaining his advantage in Arizona.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Top Hezbollah commander Abu Ali Rida 'eliminated' in air strike, says Israel
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
